sentences.english: The doctor resuscitated the man who was overcome by gas.
sentences.chinese: 医生救活了那个煤气中毒的人。

sentences.english: All experimental rats were reanimated and survived at least 1 week.
sentences.chinese: 遭受上述实验后之老鼠均可救活且至少生存一周。

sentences.english: The next day, morgana is merlin saved by magic.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，莫甘娜被梅林用魔法救活。

sentences.english: Person of Wang Jiaao whole village goes money to give thing, bring back to life A Xia.
sentences.chinese: 王家凹全村人出钱出物，救活了阿霞。

sentences.english: We have techniques to save people. We can keep mortality rates low.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以救活更多的人，保持极低的死亡率。

sentences.english: The doctors have saved the dying man.
sentences.chinese: 医生们救活了阿谁病笃的人。

sentences.english: He was nearly drowned, but we revived him.
sentences.chinese: 他几乎淹死了，但我们救活了他。

sentences.english: He reanimated a drowned child last week.
sentences.chinese: 他上周救活了一个溺水的儿童。

sentences.english: But what had she really saved?
Will ye hunt the souls of my people, and will ye save the souls alive that come unto you?
sentences.chinese: 难道你们要猎取我百姓的性命，为利己将人救活吗。

sentences.english: The doctor revived a half-drowned person.
sentences.chinese: 医生救活了一个淹得半死的人。

sentences.english: Peter tried to revive the frozen robin but it was stone - dead.
sentences.chinese: 彼得试图救活冻僵了的知更鸟，可它已完全断了气。

sentences.english: Doctors fought to keep her alive.
Government loans have been the salvation of several shaky business companies.
sentences.chinese: 政府的贷款救活了几家濒临倒闭的公司。

definition: to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
to be reborn/to recover/to come back to life/to regenerate
to kill/to cause death/to do sb to death
to provide critical care (to a patient or a diseased plant)
life/to survive/to save a life/to scrape a living
